name: 中外文化議題探討
restrict: ◎第一階段限 榮譽英語學程 ◎必須先修過【英文（二）】
description:
This course enables participants to become more effective intercultural communicators.

Intercultural communication at its most basic refers to understanding how people from different cultures behave, communicate and perceive the world around them. Understanding this, we are better equipped to avoid conflict and misunderstandings.

Over the duration of the course, students will be asked to reflect on how their own culture informs how they think, communicate and behave. Developing an understanding of how their own language and behaviour is informed by cultural values and assumptions will enable them to better understand others.

Students will be introduced to cultural dimensions such as individualism-collectivism, uncertainty avoidance, power distance, masculinity-femininity, long-term orientation and indulgence versus self-restraint. They will be led to understand how these dimensions inform everyday interactions.

Students are requested to arrive for class with enquiring minds.
goals: 強化學生英語文閱讀、聆聽的策略與能力，協助獲取專業領域新知
提昇英語文口語、寫作的表達能力，期盼學生能於工作職場及學術研究領域展現英語專業涵養。
協助學生深入瞭解國際社會的多元文化，培養國際觀，對特定文化現象進行分析、比較，激發學生之批判性思考能力。
syllabus:
Studies in Cross-Cultural Issues (Fall 2020)

Syllabus

This course will be taught in English.

Instructor: Chingshun J. Sheu 許景順 ([cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw)).

Class meetings: Wednesdays 1320-1510.

Objectives: Through the exploration of cultural issues and the (mis)perception of cultural phenomena, students will gain a more comprehensive understanding of their own culture and the concept of culture in general.

Nondiscrimination policy: Every student will be treated the same regardless of identity or cultural background. In addition, accommodations can be made for disability.

Grading:           40% Presentation

                            32% Final exam

16% Weekly quizzes

12% Participation

Presentation: Each group will give a freeform presentation on the diverse cultural backgrounds of the group members. The presentation should account in some way for the [six Hofstede Insights cultural dimensions](https://www.hofstede-insights.com/product/compare-countries/). The presentation must be in English, and may be live or prerecorded (or both). Creativity is highly encouraged. Each group will answer questions from the other groups after the presentation.

Final exam: Students will have one week to answer the open-book take-home exam. No late submissions. _Plagiarism will result in an exam grade of 0 (zero)._

Weekly quizzes: Students should read the assigned texts _before class_ each week and answer the open-book repeatable weekly quiz online. During class, students will divide into groups to discuss questions from the instructor. They will then share their answers with the class. No makeup quizzes.

Participation: Participation includes two parts, both based on peer evaluations from fellow group members. The first part is how much each group member contributes to the presentation. The second part is how much each group member participates in deciding the questions that each group must ask each presenting group. Peer evaluations will not be directly translated into the participation grade, but will rather serve as indicators of participation.
